description: What's causing global stock markets to approach new records? Starting this summer, for the first time since 1856, you won't be able to trade wheat in Kansas City. In 2011, borrowers defaulted on almost a billion dollars in Perkins loans, federal loans for the lowest-income students, and now some schools are going to court to get their money. And finally, Hasbro will announce which one its famous Monopoly tokens it plans to retire.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 6, 2013
teaser: What's causing global stock markets to approach new records? Starting this summer, for the first time since 1856, you won't be able to trade wheat in Kansas City. In 2011, borrowers defaulted on almost a billion dollars in Perkins loans, federal loans for the lowest-income students, and now some schools are going to court to get their money. And finally, Hasbro will announce which one its famous Monopoly tokens it plans to retire.
byline: Queena Kim, David Brancaccio, Amy Scott, Jeremy Bernfeld, Rebecca Singer, Paddy Hirsch, Jim Burress, Sam Beard and Jeremy Hobson
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 6, 2013
